children.name: when a country, company etc is in a particular place
stand b2
children.definition: stand if abuildingorstructurestands somewhere, it is in that place:
examples: ▪ there is a parking lot now where the old school once stood.
stand in/near/on there etc
▪ the house stood next to a church.

children.name: be a1
children.definition: be/bi, strong biː/ ở
examples: be in/on/near/there etc
ở trong / trên / gần / đó vv
▪ egypt is in north africa.
▪ the bank is on the next corner.
▪ can you tell me where the station is?

children.name: be based b2
children.definition: be based if acompanyororganizationis based in a place, its main offices are there:được đặt trụ sở
examples: be based in/at
▪ the united nations is based in new york.
▪ more than 200 aircraft will be based at miramar air force base.
london-based/tokyo-based etc
▪ a london-based insurance company

children.name: be located b1
children.definition: be located/situated if a buildingis located/situatedin a particular street, town, or area, it is in that place. be located/situatedis more formal thanbe.:được đặt ở
examples: be located/situated in/at/near/there etc
▪ the bookshop is located at 120 charing cross road.
▪ a u.s. air force base is located nearby.
▪ the duke’s home is situated in an attractive part of central london.
conveniently/pleasantly/ideally situated
▪ a new hotel, conveniently situated close to the airport
conveniently/pleasantly/ideally located
▪ the two fisheries are ideally located between major markets in new york and boston.

children.name: a place where sb usually often goes
sb’s place a1
children.definition: somebody’s place/ somebodyˈs ˈpleɪs/  the place where someone usuallysitsorstands, especially in a bar, at work, or in their home:
examples: chỗ ai đó
▪ gerard was in his usual place by the fire when i reached the pub.
take your placesit or stand in a place where you usually sit or stand
lại chỗ của bạn
▪ the children took their places, and the teacher began calling the roll.

children.name: haunt x
children.definition: haunt a place such as a bar or park that sb likes to go to often, especially in order to meet people:nơi hay lai vãng
examples: cafes like ‘les deux magots’ were once the favourite haunts of french artists and intellectuals.
old hauntswhere someone used to go at another time in their life
johnson will be revisting all his old haunts in washington.
this pub used to be one of youroldhaunts, didn't it jim?

children.name: hangout x
children.definition: hangoutinformala place where a particular group of people, especially young people, often go to meet, talk etc:nơi lui tới thường xuyên
examples: in new york, try one of the celebrity hangouts, such as the russian tea room or elaine’s.
a teenage hangout on fountain street
the café is a favourite hangout of artists.
hangout for
the bar is a favorite hangout for soldiers from the nearby base.

children.name: when sth is usually kept in a place
belong b2
children.definition: belong/ go especially spoken if somethinggoesorbelongsin a place, it should always be put there when it is not being used:
examples: put everything back where it belongs when you’re through.
go/belong in/on/under etc
‘where do these plates go?’ ‘they go in the cupboard above the sink.’
the books belong in the shelves, not on the floor.

children.name: its place a1
children.definition: its/their place the place where sth is normally kept or put:chỗ của nó/chúng
examples: ▪ the kids never put anything back in its place.
its/their usual place
▪ i can’t find the coffee tin -- it isn’t in its usual place.

children.name: out of place c2
children.definition: out of placenot in the correct or usual position :
examples: the kitchen was spotlessly clean, with nothing out of place.

children.name: in place c2
children.definition: in placein the correct position :
examples: the chairs for the concert were nearly all in place.
the glass washeld in placeby a few pieces of sellotape.
the chairs are all in place.
he screwed the shelf in place.

children.name: place a1
children.definition: placea point or area, especially one that you visit or use for a particular purpose
examples: make sure you keep the key in a safe place.
i’ve spent the day dashing about from place to place.
the place was full of screaming children.
he was threatening to burn the place down.
she had never been back to the place where the accident happened.
the theatre bar was our usual meeting place.
we were living then in a place called alberiga.
the wall was quite dampin places(= in some places ).
place for
this is a great place for a holiday.
this would be a great place for a party!
a place to sit/eat/sleep etc
sign your name on the list, and find yourself a place to sit.
i was looking for a place to park the car.
right/wrong place
are you sure this is the right place? i don’t see emma.
a meeting placethe club was a meeting place for musicians.
a hiding placehe had watched the farm workers from his hiding place.
a resting place(= a place where someone or something stays or is buried )this tomb is the last resting place of the davison family.
sb’s place of birthformal i need to know his date of birth, and his place of birth.
sb’s place of work/employmentformal please give the address of your place of work.
sb’s place of residenceformal by law, you must inform us if you change your place of residence.
sb’s/sth’s place of originformal(= the place where someone or something first came from )i believe my mother's place of origin was sierra leone.
a place of safetyhis young son had been sent away to a place of safety.
a place of refuge(= somewhere safe to go or hide )if ever you need a place of refuge, come to us.
a place of worshipthe church is much more than a place of worship.
a place of pilgrimage(= one that people visit because it is special, usually for a religious reason )her grave became a place of pilgrimage.

children.name: location b1
children.definition: location slightly formal a particular place, especially in relation to other areas, buildings etc - used especially in business, advertising, or in official contexts: địa điểm
examples: its isolatedgeographical location
a new hotel in an attractive location
the time, date, and location of the conference have not yet been announced.
authorities say they have pinpointed the location of the sunken ship.
in a good/ lovely/ etc location
the hotel isina lovely location overlooking the lake.
his apartment is in a really good location.
register:locationis often used when talking about buying, or selling property. in everyday english in other contexts, people usually sayplace:
it can be stressful moving to a newplace.

children.name: site b1
children.definition: site
examples: 1a place where something important or interesting happened :
an archaeological site
site of
the house is built on the site of a medieval prison.
the site of the air crash
2an area of ground where something is being built or will be built
site of/for
the site of a proposed missile base
a site for a new airport
building/construction site
he managed to get himself a job on a building site.
3a place that is used for a particular purpose :
acamping site
site of/for
a nesting site for birds
an archaeological sitearchaeological sites are often discovered by accident.
a historic sitethere are numerous historic sites to visit.
an ancient sitethe organization maintains and restores ancient sites, castles, monuments etc.
a sacred site(= a place that is important in a religion )ayers rock is the most sacred site of the aborigines.
a burial sitea bronze age burial site has been discovered.
the crash site(= where a plane etc crashed )wreckage was seen 200 metres away from the crash site.
a bomb site(= where a bomb has exploded )the bomb sites of war-torn london
a building/construction sitehe has worked on various building sites.
a greenfield sitebritish english(= a piece of land that has never been built on )we want to shift the balance of housing development from greenfield to brownfield sites.
a brownfield sitebritish english(= a piece of land that has been built on before )the majority of the houses will be built on brownfield sites.
a camp/camping sitefirst they had to look for a camp site.
a caravan sitebre: a well-run caravan site near the river brings holidaymakers into the village.
a landfill site(= where rubbish is buried )recycling reduces the volume of waste which goes into landfill sites.
an industrial site(= where factories are )the area is to be redeveloped as an industrial site.
a missile sitethere were photos of a missile site under construction.
a nesting sitenormally the male swan won’t let other swans near his nesting site.

children.name: spot b2
children.definition: spot rather informal a particular place or area, especially a pleasant place where you spend time or live :
examples: a nice quiet spot on the beach
i chose a spot well away from the road.
holiday spotuk /vacation spotus
las vegas has a growing reputation as an entertainment and vacation spot.
in a spot
a small cottage in an idyllic spot
on a spot
why do they want to build a house on this particular spot?
spot for
an ideal spot for a picnic

children.name: venue b2
children.definition: venue a place where an organized meeting, concert etc takes place : nơi gặp gỡ
examples: the hotel is a popular wedding venue.
sporting/conference/concert etc venue
the first thing to do isbookavenue.
the band willplay(= perform at )as manyvenuesas possible.
venue for
the venue for the latest round of talks
the restaurant is one of the few venues for jazz music in the area.
ministers have not yet agreed on a venue for the next conference on european security.
the venue for the next olympic games

children.name: whereabouts c2
children.definition: whereabouts the place where someone or something is – used especially when you do not know this or do not want to tell people :chỗ ở, nơi ở
examples: sb’s whereabouts
trupin is thought to be in the caribbean, although his exact whereabouts are/is a mystery.
the police received an anonymous tip about the suspect’s whereabouts.
despite numerous searches and enquiries, her whereabouts are still unknown.
whereabouts of
the police have appealed for information concerning the whereabouts of the stolen car used in the robbery.
they tried to torture him into revealing the whereabouts of the $90 million, but he didn’t know anything.
the whereabouts of the painting is unknown

children.name: somewhere a1
children.definition: somewhereused for talking about a place when you are not sure exactly which place :
examples: she came from somewhere in london.

children.name: of a2
children.definition: ofprepositionposition
examples: used in expressions showing position
_the top of his head
_the back of your dress
_on the corner of the street
_the front of the queue
_i've never been north ofedinburgh.

children.name: setting b2
children.definition: settingnounposition vị trí
examples: [ c usually singular ]the position of a house or other building
_their cottage is in an idyllic rural setting.

children.name: scene b2
children.definition: scene the place where an accident, crime etc happened : hiện trường
examples: the police soon arrived atthe scene of the crime.
the police arrived to find a sceneofhorrifying destruction.
evidence was found at the sceneof the crime.
at the scene
investigators are now at the scene, searching for clues.
on the scene
journalists were on the scene within minutes.

children.name: position c1
children.definition: position c1 the place where people are sent in order to carry out a course of action:
examples: the troops took up their battle positions at the front line.
as soon as his officers wereinposition/had movedintoposition, the police commander walked up the path towards the house.

children.name: when an object is in a particular place
be a1
children.definition: be/bi, strong biː/ ở
examples: ▪ do you know where my keys are?
be in/on/near/there etc
▪ the television is in the living room.
▪ your supper’s in the oven.
▪ there’s a letter for you on the table.

children.name: stand b2
children.definition: stand /stænd/  to be in a particular place in an upright position:có ở
examples: ▪ the linoleum was dented where a washer and dryer once stood.
stand in/on/near/there etc
a single tall candle stood in the middle of the table.
▪ a christmas tree stood near the fireplace.

children.name: lie b1
children.definition: lie/laɪ/  to be in a flat position on a surface - use this about paper, clothes, books, or other things that can be placed flat:nằm ở
examples: lie in/on/near/there etc
▪ several letters were lying on the table
.▪ the children’s clothes were lying all over the bedroom floor.
▪ her packed suitcase was lying near the door.

children.name: spoken: where sb or sth is, where they are from etc
where a1
children.definition: where/weəʳ/ ở đâu
examples: ▪ where are you?
▪ this is where we keep all our junk.
▪ i can’t remember where i last saw it.
▪ could you tell me where the nearest tourist information office is?
▪ where are you going?
▪ where did you buy those shoes?
where ... to
▪ neighbours have no idea where the couple have moved to.
where to? spoken used to asksb where they are going
▪ ‘would you like to come with us tonight?’ ‘where to?’
where ... from
▪ where did you get that magazine from?
where sb comes from
▪ in all that time naomi never told me where she came from.

children.name: whereabouts c2
children.definition: whereabouts especially spoken use this when you are asking in what general area sth is:nơi nào
examples: did he say whereabouts he hid it?
‘i’m from thailand.’ ‘whereabouts?’
whereabouts in scotland is perthshire?

children.name: where on earth a1
children.definition: where on earth/ where in the world where - use this especially to show surprise or disapproval:ở đâu trên thế giới này
examples: ▪ where on earth are you going dressed like that?
▪ we’ve been looking for you for hours. where in the world have you been?
▪ when he woke up, he could not remember where on earth he was.

children.name: behind b1
children.definition: behindadverbplace
examples: in the placewhere someone or something was before
_i was annoyed to discover that i'dleftmy bag behind.( toi da buc minh khi thay rang yoi da de tui xach dang sau )
_after the party a few peoplestayedbehind to help clear up.

children.name: in b1
children.definition: inadverbat place
examples: at home or at work
_when did you get home? i never heard you come in.
_mr ellis isn't in this week.

children.name: on site c1
children.definition: on site
examples: inside a factory, office building, etc.
_there are two restaurants on site.
_the office complex has an on-site nursery.

children.name: out of place c2
children.definition: out of placenot suitable for a particular situation or occasion :
examples: he never seemed to feel out of place at social functions.
the paintings looked strangely out of place.
the boy looked uncomfortable and out of place among the adults.

children.name: the exact place where sth is or happens
position b1
children.definition: position
examples: 1[c] the place where someone or something is, especially in relation to other objects and places
she showed me the position of the village on the map.
i changed the position of the mirror slightly.
jessica moved to a position where she could see the stage better.
position of
the position ofthe sun in the sky
our hotel was in a superbcentral positionnear st mark’s square.
thestrategic position(= useful or important position )of egypt in relation to the arabian peninsula
2 correct place[c or u] the place where someone or something is needed or supposed to be
into position
he pulled the ladder into position.
in/out of position
all parking signs have now been placed in position.

children.name: point x
children.definition: point a particular place on alineor on asurface, especially a place that is used formeasuringdistances, heights etc:điểm
examples: the river at this point is half a mile wide.
soon they came to a point where the road divided.
ward hill, at over 700 feet, is the island’s highest point.
at this point the path gets narrower. |no cars are allowed beyond this point.

children.name: spot b2
children.definition: spot rather informal the exact place where something is or happens:nơi, điểm
examples: people had left flowers at the spot where the police officer was killed.
the exact/very/same etc spot
the museum sits on the exact spot where gold was first discovered.
she agreed to meet him at the same spot the next evening.
the exact spot where the king was executed

children.name: location b1
children.definition: location the place where someone or something is, or where something happens.
examples: your exact location
the prisoners were taken to an undisclosed location.
location of
a map showing the locationofthe property will be sent to you.
exact/precise locationwritten the exact place where something is or happens địa điểm chính xác
the map shows theprecise locationof the crash.
the exact location of the ship, which sank in 1857, is being kept secret.
a military spokesman would not reveal the exact location of the search area.
molecular biologists have found the precise location of the gene.
